info.name: Import Tag
info.description: All Calculated variables needed for this collection are stored as Collection Variables. These variables should not be manually changed since all IDs are set based on the responses from previous requests.

exec: pm.test("Extension Package IDs saved for: "+ extensionPackages.toString(), function () {

request.description:
### Extension Package IDs to be saved:

*   ECID
*   Target v2
*   Analytics
*   ACDL
*   AEP
*   Event Mapping Table
*   Target v1.8
*   Contexthub
    

### Collection Variable Naming:

*   `extPackageID_< name >`
    

Where `< name >` is derived from the response: `data.attributes.name`

request.description:
By default, a tag property is created with the Core extension installed. Therefore the Core extension ID needs to be saved so it can be added to the Library for publishing later.

### Collection Variable Naming:

*   `extID-core` - Core extension ID

item.description:
# Setup

1.  Go to the **Pre-request script** tab
2.  Update the **propName** value to the desired property name.
3.  Run this folder as a collection runner

item.name: Add rule and cmps (datafile & pre-request)

request.description: This is a filler request that allows the Add Rule request to only run on the first iteration of the datafile, ensuring all rule components in the datafile are added to the same rule.

exec: //evKey and evValue are the only values that should be changed in this script. Everything else is boilerplate.

request.description:
Creates a new rule based on the ruleName from the Pre-request script of this folder. This is only run once per datafile to ensure all rule components are added to the same rule.

### Collection Variable Naming:

*   `ruleID_< name >` - ID of the rule created
    

Where `< name >` is derived from the response: `data.attributes.name`

exec: //evKey and evValue are the only values that should be changed in this script. Everything else is boilerplate.

request.description: Adds the rule component to the specified rule from the ruleName. Rule components aren't added to the collection variables since they are auto-added to the library when the rule ID is added.

request.description:
Finds all Collection variables that start with:

*   extID
*   dataElementID
*   ruleID
    

and adds the IDs to the Library to be built and published to production

### Collection Variable Naming:

*   `libraryID`Â - ID of the library to be built
